alert.note: Alert for Bartow; Cobb; Paulding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 5:22PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Paulding, northwestern Cobb and southeastern Bartow Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 521 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Cartersville, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Cartersville, Kennesaw, Acworth, Emerson, George Washington Carver St Pk, Burnt Hickory Ridge, and Red Top Mountain State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
